data.title: The Range Planet
data.meta_description: Gloria Gaynor Vocal Range: A2-B♭5 Voice Type: My Other Songs Didn't Survive Mezzo (1965-
data.text:
Post by Steve on

Gloria Gaynor

Vocal Range: A2-B♭5

Voice Type: My Other Songs Didn't Survive Mezzo (1965-201?); Only the Contralto Survived (201?-Present)

Years Active: 1965-Present

Longest Sustain: 13 Seconds (I Will Always Love You)

Significant High Notes:

B♭5 ("Midnight Rocker")

A5 ("Let's Make Love", "Please, Be There", "Substitute", "Tease Me")

G♯5 ("False Alarm", "Let's Make a Deal", "Never Can Say Goodbye", "Runaround Love", "Say Something")

G5 ("Honey Bee", "How High the Moon", "This Side of the Pain", "I've Got You Under My Skin", "Midnight Rocker", "One Number One", "Reach Out, I'll Be There", "Stoplight", "You Took Me In Again")

In the Name of Love", "Walk on By", "You", "You're the First, the last, My Everything")

C♯3 ("Casanova Brown", "Guess Who", "Never Be Lonely", "Never Can Say Goodbye" Gloria Gaynor '90/'91 version, "The Reason for the Season", "Suddenly")

C3 ("All I Want Is You for Christmas", "Come Tonight", "Don't Stop Us", "First Be a Woman", "I've Been Watching You", "Let It Rain, "Let's Make Love", "You Can Exit")

B2 ("Tease Me")

A2 ("You Can Exit")

.......................................

Blue marks falsetto and whistle notes.

Bold marks particularly impressive notes.

Italics mark non-melodic notes.

Underlines indicate that the note is in the background vocals or harmonies.

{Questionable Notes}E6 ("You"*)

B♭5 ("The Heat Is On"*)

E5 ("Gone Too Long"†)

C3 ("The Christmas Song"§)

B2 ("Come Tonight"‡, "First Be a Woman"‡, "Walk On By"‡)

B♭2 ("I've Been Watching You"‡, "Strive" I'll Be There version I don't know why this one isn't countable, "You Can Exit"‡)

A2 ("Walk On By"‡)

G♯2 ("Guess Who"§)

? Talk, Talk, Talk

* Indicates that the relevant note may be an overtone.

† Indicates that the relevant note may be a backing singer.

‡ Indicates that the relevant note is not entirely aimed for, is spoken, and has more significant notes included in the body of the thread.

§ Indicates that the relevant note is brief and, therefore, likely not countable.

Many interviews I have seen with Gaynor feature her frequently speaking at pitches all the way down to G2.

{Notewatched Albums}Never Can Say Goodbye (1975): B2-G♯5

Experience Gloria Gaynor (1975): A2-G5

I've Got You (1976): C3-A5

Glorious (1977): D3-F♯5

Gloria Gaynor's Park Avenue Sounds (1978): E3-G♯5

Love Tracks (1978): A2-A5

I Have A Right (1979): C3-B5

Stories (1980): F3-E5

I Kinda Like Me (1981): F3-G5

Gloria Gaynor (1982): B2-C6

I Am Gloria Gaynor (1984): B♭2-F5

The Power of Gloria Gaynor (1986): C♯3-F♯5

Gloria Gaynor '90 (1990): C3-F♯5

Love Affair (1992): C♯3-D5

I'll Be There (1994):B♭2-F♯5

The Answer (1997): C3-F♯5

I Wish You Love (2002):B2-F5

Gloria Gaynor's Christmas Presence (2007):C3-C♯5

We Will Survive (2013):D3-D5

Testimony (partial song previews, from website, so hopefully not reflective of the album) (2017?): E♭3-C♯5

{Notes}All bolded notes are linked, notes C♯3 and below and G♯5 and above are linked. All questionable notes and recommended songs with only version are linked as well. Bolded notes around C5 in songs from her more recent releases are not necessarily better than all other's at that note, but are well executed with her voice in it's current state.

Thread originally by alliexandras. See this thread for more information.
